concept.title: System Requirements
concept.shortdesc: System requirements for a Mac OS X install

dd.p: Mac OS X version 10.5 64-bit or later.

dlentry.dd: CPU (processor): minimum - Intel Pentium III/AMD Athlon class processor, 500 Mhz; recommended - Dual Core class processor.
Minimum - 1 GB RAM 512 MB of RAM ; recommended - 2 GB of RAM512 MB of RAM .
minimum - 300 MB free disk space 100 MB free disk space; recommended - 500 MB free disk space200 MB free disk space.

dd.p: Installation packages are supplied in compressed archives. Ensure you have installed a suitable archive extraction utility with which to extract the archive. The MD5 sum is available at the Download page the Download page for every archive. You should check the MD5 sum of the downloaded archive with an MD5 checking tool.

dlentry.dd:
requires Java to run. Mac OS X includes Java by default.
supports only official and stable Java Virtual Machines with the version number or later (the recommended version is 1.6.0) from Oracle, formerly Sun Microsystems (available at http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html). may work with JVM implementations from other vendors, but there is no guarantee that other implementations will work with future releases. does not work with the GNU libgcj Java Virtual Machine.
To ensure that the correct version of Java is used:
Make sure that he PATH environment variable is set to the most current Java Virtual Machine installation.
Make sure that references to older Java Virtual Machine installations are removed from the PATH.
To specify a different Java Virtual Machine for to use, set the home folder of the desired Java Virtual Machine in one of the JAVA_HOME or JDK_HOME environment variables. If JAVA_HOME and JDK_HOME are not set, the launcher looks for a JVM installed in a standard location on your computer and uses it to start the application.
